newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ahold sees significantly higher 1996 net.
newsitem.headline: Ahold sees significantly higher 1996 net.

text.p: Dutch supermarkets group Ahold NV said on Wednesday that net earnings in 1996, including Stop & Shop, would be significantly higher than in 1995.

The company had said before that the acquisition of U.S. retail group Stop & Shop, which was included in Ahold's figures for the first time in the third quarter, would give a further boost to operating profit and profit after tax.

In an interview last Friday, Ahold's head of communication Hans Gobes said the company broadly adhered to a Dutch convention under which the Dutch term 'belangrijk' would indicate a rise of 12-20 percent.
Ahold said that the acquisition of Stop & Shop would boost turnover, operating profits and net results.
"Further growth of earnings per share is expected to be positively influenced by the acquisition of Stop & Shop," Ahold said in a statement.
Earlier, Ahold reported third quarter 1996 profits of 156.4 million guilders versus 101.6 million guilders in the same period of 1995.
